isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - SLEEPER LIGHTING AND ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Bunk Fluorescent And Reading Lights With 48 And 60 Inch Box Sleeper

svcproc.title: Bunk Fluorescent And Reading Lights With 48 And 60 Inch Box Sleeper
svcproc.para: When either of the two bunk dome light switches is moved, current will flow from battery stud (B2), through circuit 14AP, fuse F8-D, circuits 14AX, 14P, 14N, fuse L3, circuits 63AC, and 63F to the bunk fluorescent light. The ground circuit is 11U or 11P between the two switches, and circuit 11C, and 11B to sleeper ground.

When the bunk reading light switch is turned on, current will flow from battery stud (B2), through circuit 14AP, fuse F8 - D, circuits 14AX, 14P, 14N, fuse L3, circuits 63AC, and 63D to the reading light switch and lamp. The ground circuit is 11R and 11B to sleeper ground.
